title: Nuaulu - Mark (Print)
description: Nuaulu is a language indigenous to the island of Seram Island in Indonesia, and it is spoken by the Nuaulu people. The language is split into two dialects, a northern and a southern dialect, between which there a communication barrier. The Nuaulu, Naulu or Nunuhai are a tribe located in Seram, Maluku, Indonesia.

language.name: North Nuaulu
language.area: Central Maluku, central Seram Island north coast. 2 villages.
